title: France's PM Lecornu Resigns After Less Than 24 Hours Amid Political Crisis
snippets: Facing criticism from all sides, France's new prime minister Sébastien Lecornu resigned less than 24 hours after naming his government and after less than a month in office, plunging the country into a deep political crisis.
He criticised the "partisan appetites" of political factions, who he said had refused to compromise.
French Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu has stepped down, blaming deep divisions in parliament.
President Emmanuel Macron accepts resignation of newly appointed prime minister after criticism over cabinet lineup.
Sébastien Lecornu quits after rightwing allies indicated they could withdraw from his government

Sébastien Lecornu quits, blaming political “egos”, after Emmanuel Macron unveiled largely unchanged cabinet lineup

France’s political crisis has deepened after the new prime minister dramatically resigned within hours of appointing a government.

Sébastien Lecornu was the third French
Sébastien Lecornu, a former defense minister, was in the job less than a month. He was appointed after a no-confidence vote toppled his predecessor.
Sébastien Lecornu stepped down less than 24 hours after he had formed his cabinet.
titles: France's prime minister resigns after less than a month in office
French Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu resigns after less than a month
France’s prime minister resigns over divisions after just weeks in office
France’s new Prime Minister Lecornu resigns hours after naming cabinet
France’s prime minister resigns less than a month after appointment
France’s PM resigns after less than a month amid widespread criticism of new cabinet
Prime minister of France resigns hours after naming new government
French Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu Resigns
summary: Sébastien Lecornu, France's newly appointed Prime Minister, resigned less than 24 hours after forming his government and less than a month in office, citing deep political divisions and criticism from various factions, including threats from rightwing allies to withdraw support. His resignation, accepted by President Emmanuel Macron, follows criticism over the largely unchanged cabinet lineup and plunges the country into a political crisis. Lecornu, a former defense minister, had assumed the role after a no-confidence vote ousted his predecessor.

title: 2025 Nobel Prize in Medicine Awarded for Autoimmunity Research
snippets: Mary E. Brunkow, Fred Ramsdell and Shimon Sakaguchi were honored for research into how the body helps the immune system avoid attacking your own tissues instead of foreign invaders.
The international team discovered how the immune system is kept in check to prevent it attacking the body.

Mary E. Brunkow, Fred Ramsdell, and Shimon Sakaguchi will be awarded the Nobel Prize in physiology or medicine for their instrumental work in improving our understanding of how the immune system functions.
The 2025 Nobel prize in physiology or medicine has gone to Mary Brunkow, Fred Ramsdell and Shimon Sakaguchi for their discoveries around how we keep our immune system under control
Three scientists honoured for research on what prevents immune cells from attacking the body

Mary E Brunkow, Fred Ramsdell and Shimon Sakaguchi worked on how the immune system can be prevented from harming the body

The Nobel prize in physiology or medicine 2025 has been awarded to three scientists for their work on how the immune system is kept in check and prevented from attacking
A US-Japanese trio on Monday won the Nobel Prize in Medicine for research into how the immune system is kept in check by identifying its "security guards," the Nobel jury said.
titles: The medicine Nobel Prize goes to 3 scientists for work on peripheral immune tolerance
Nobel Prize for medicine awarded to immune system researchers
Trio wins Nobel Prize in medicine for immune system research
Nobel prize for medicine goes to trio for work on immune tolerance
Nobel Prize in medicine awarded for immune system breakthroughs
Nobel prize in medicine awarded to scientists for immune system research
Medicine Nobel to trio who identified immune system's 'security guards'
summary: Mary E. Brunkow, Fred Ramsdell, and Shimon Sakaguchi were awarded the 2025 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for their groundbreaking research on how the immune system is regulated to prevent it from attacking the body's own tissues. Their work, which involves the identification of mechanisms that help maintain immune system balance, has been pivotal in advancing our understanding of autoimmunity. This US-Japanese team's discoveries have significantly contributed to the field of immunology.

title: Trump Deploys National Guard to Chicago, Faces Legal Challenge Over Portland
snippets: The decision late on Sunday comes a day after the same judge barred the deployment of troops from the state of Oregon.
The deployment would mark the latest escalation of Donald Trump’s use of US federal intervention in Democrat-led cities.

A judge has issued a ruling temporarily blocking Donald Trump's effort to send the National Guard to Portland. Trump says troops are needed to clamp down on protests against federal immigration operations in the city.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMikAFBVV95cUxQSU83ZkFnMmR4eDlDN2l1Rk1DbVNjclFRaHM4VWZWcG1UWUJkbERQTE13MDBHTWVNRFRDcE1tWTc3NGx2TFJJTHRHN2pGQXROZ3FzR2I5Ny13eGpHSkZwVnBnOTA0YXU2bl9NUDdCbGtYZzRoS1Rvb05MMGVWYVJqQjRRNTJ1aUpIZG9WRFRaN3o?oc=5" target="_blank">Judge temporarily blocks Trump f

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMieEFVX3lxTE1SNEQwYU1yYjl5Z2JlOXhkTWVGR0V1QXVXNTZXZTlOdEhPNU50MXlkOHNBcE5hVDBKeV9uYmJaUGxjLVZjdjFoaVUwbk91WTZvSkY0QjlSR0VINGF3R0tXZTNWZjFSempoclpWblNGcktuNERETmVJZw?oc=5" target="_blank">Newsom says Trump sent California National Guard troops to Oregon
A federal judge barred Trump from deploying National Guard troops to Oregon after the California Guard was sent to the state Sunday.
Trump attempted to deploy the California and Texas National Guard in Portland after a judge halted his bid to send Oregon National Guard troops to the city.
“This action circumvents the court’s decision and threatens to inflame a community that has remained peaceful,” Portland's mayor said.
titles: Judge blocks Trump from sending troops from California to Portland
Gov Newsom says Trump is sending California National Guard troops to Oregon
Judge blocks Trump's attempts to deploy troops to Portland
Judge temporarily blocks Trump from any sending National Guard troops to Oregon - Axios
Newsom says Trump sent California National Guard troops to Oregon - Axios
Judge blocks Trump from deploying California National Guard — or any Guard troops — in Oregon
Judge Blocks Trump’s Deployment Of National Guard Troops From Any State In Oregon
Trump sends California National Guard to Oregon after judge blocks him from using that state’s troops in Portland
summary: President Trump authorized the deployment of 300 Illinois National Guard members to Chicago as part of his immigration and crime crackdown, while also attempting to send troops to Portland, Oregon. However, the deployment to Portland was blocked by a federal judge. In response, Trump is trying to send 300 California National Guard members instead, leading California Governor Newsom to announce plans to sue the White House. This marks an escalation in Trump's use of federal intervention in Democrat-led cities.

title: Trump Optimistic on Israel-Hamas Talks Amid Gaza Violence
snippets: German Foreign Minister Johann Wadephul is heading to Egypt and Israel as negotiations over US President Donald Trump's plan for Gaza kick off. DW has the latest.

Negotiators from the US, Israel and Hamas are set to begin talks, as the US president said the first phase should be completed this week

  • Israel continues

Talks on Monday expected to focus on release of hostages and end to war, after Israel kills 63 people in Gaza in past day

Donald Trump has urged negotiators to “move fast” in talks focused on the release of hostages held by Hamas in Gaza and a broader end to the war, as representatives arri

Discussions in Egypt expected to focus on path to peace and release of hostages, after Israel killed dozens of people in just over 24 hours. Plus, why are young Americans eating so early?

Good morning.

Donald Trump has urged negotiators to “move fast” in talks focused on the release o
Israel and Hamas are set to gather in Egypt for indirect talks over a U.S.-backed plan to end the Gaza war after months of deadlock.
Though significant issues remain to be hashed out between Israel and Hamas, some are saying that after two years of death and destruction, a breakthrough may be near.

summary: US President Donald Trump expressed optimism about the speed of negotiations between Israel and Hamas, focusing on the release of hostages and ending the conflict. This comes as talks are set to begin, following a deadly day in Gaza where 63 people were killed by Israeli forces. Trump has urged for quick action in these discussions.

title: British Carmaker Blames Shortfall on Economy, Trump Policies, Cyber-Attack

  • B

Aston Martin issues profit warning citing US tariff impact
Aston Martin warns on profits amid US tariffs and seeks ‘proactive support’
summary: A British carmaker attributes its financial shortfall to the global economic slowdown and Donald Trump's trade policies, citing weaker demand and supply chain pressures exacerbated by a cyber-attack on Jaguar Land Rover.

title: Indonesia School Collapse Death Toll Hits 50; Search for Missing Continues
snippets: Rescue teams search for survivors in Indonesia as the boarding school collapse death toll rises to at least 40.
A week after a school building collapsed in Indonesia, rescuers are still searching for missing people. So far, at least 50 bodies have been recovered.

Excavators used to remove rubble while 14 people reportedly still unaccounted for and police allege building work was being carried out without a permit

Indonesian rescuers searching for missing students after a prayer hall at an
titles: Parents see tragedy, not fault, in Indonesia school collapse
Death toll from Indonesia school collapse climbs to at least 50
Indonesia school collapse death toll reaches 54 as search for missing students continues
summary: The collapse of the Al Khoziny Islamic boarding school in Indonesia has become the country's deadliest disaster this year, with the death toll rising to at least 50. Rescue teams continue their search for survivors, with 14 people still missing. The collapse occurred while building work, reportedly conducted without a permit, was underway. Excavators are being used to remove rubble as the search for missing students persists.

title: Yesavage's No-Hit Game and Guerrero's Slam Propel Blue Jays to 2-0 ALDS Lead
snippets: Yesavage allowed no hits and struck out 11 of the 18 batters he faced on Sunday
Trey Yesavage said he was built for this kind of opportunity. On Sunday afternoon, he went out and proved it.

Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit a grand slam, Daulton Varsho hit two of Toronto's five homers and Trey Yesavage was masterful in his fourth career big-league start as the Blue Jays defeated the New York Yankees 13-7 on Sunday to take a 2-0 lead in the American League Division Series.

Trey Yesavage recorded a franchise-best 11 strikeouts through 5.1 hitless innings, Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit a grand slam, and Daulton Varsho recorded two homers and two doubles to lead the Toronto Blue Jays to a 13-7 win over the New York Yankees.
titles: Trey Yesavage shuts down Yankees in ALDS Game 2 as Blue Jays rookie sets franchise strikeout record
Blue Jays outscore Yankees 13-7 in Game 2 of ALDS
Blue Jays beat Yankees 13-7 in Game 2 of ALDS
MLB Game 2 Highlights: Blue Jays 13, Yankees 7
summary: Trey Yesavage delivered a no-hit performance with 11 strikeouts in his fourth big-league start, leading the Toronto Blue Jays to a 13-7 victory over the New York Yankees. This win gave the Blue Jays a 2-0 lead in the ALDS. Vladimir Guerrero Jr. contributed with a grand slam, while Daulton Varsho hit two of Toronto's five home runs. The team's performance has been historically significant, matching their home run tally (eight) with fewer strikeouts (seven) across two games.

title: Supreme Court Term Begins, Presidential Power Limits in Focus

Two 0f the world’s best-known authoritarian leaders – Viktor Orbán, Hungary’s prime minister, and Recep
titles: President Trump and the Supreme Court
Why does the supreme court keep bending the knee to Trump? | Steven Greenhouse
summary: The Supreme Court's new term starts today, amid concerns over its failure to limit presidential power, which critics argue has had negative consequences. This term's outcomes could have significant implications, especially in the context of global authoritarian trends highlighted by leaders like Hungary's Viktor Orbán and Turkey's Recep Tayyip Erdoğan.

The author of 18 ‘bonkbuster’ novels including Riders, Rivals and Bella has died following a fall

Share your memories of Jilly Cooper

Jilly Cooper has died at th
A prolific writer and keen observer, she sold millions of copies of her juicy, sometimes racy “Rutshire Chronicles” series.
titles: Jilly Cooper, author of Rivals and Riders, dies aged 88
Jilly Cooper, British Romance Novelist, Is Dead at 88
summary: Jilly Cooper, the acclaimed author known for her "Rutshire Chronicles" series, including popular novels such as "Riders" and "Rivals," has passed away following a fall. Cooper was celebrated for her engaging storytelling and vibrant characters, selling millions of copies worldwide. Fans and readers are invited to share their memories and tributes.

title: Best-Selling Author Jilly Cooper Dies at 88

The writer Jilly Cooper, who has died aged 88, was a Georgian at heart, with all the 18th century’s preference fo
titles: Dame Jilly Cooper: Undisputed queen of the joyous British bonkbuster
Dame Jilly Cooper obituary
summary: Jilly Cooper, the best-selling author known for her novels such as "Riders" and "Rivals," which depicted love, lust, and equestrian themes set in the English countryside, has passed away at the age of 88. Her work was celebrated for its vibrant portrayal of the Georgian era's indulgences.

title: French Court to Rehear Rape Case After Convict Appeals Sentence
snippets: The rape trial that shocked the world will be discussed in a French court once again, after one of the men convicted of raping Gisele Pelicot appealed, insisting that he is "not a rapist."
The Frenchwoman who became a feminist icon will confront one of the men convicted after her husband drugged her and invited them to rape her over nearly 10 years.
titles: France: Gisele Pelicot to face court again due to appeal
What to Know as Gisèle Pelicot Returns to Court for Man’s Appeal
summary: A French court is set to revisit a high-profile rape case after a convicted man appealed his sentence, claiming innocence. The case, which gained global attention, involves a Frenchwoman, Gisele Pelicot, who was raped over nearly a decade after her husband drugged her and allowed other men to assault her. Pelicot, now a feminist icon, will face one of the convicted individuals in court again due to his appeal.

title: Patriots Beat Bills 23-20, End NFL's Undefeated Streak
snippets: The New England Patriots defeated the Buffalo Bills to leave the NFL without an unbeaten team just five weeks into the season.

Drake Maye led the Patriots on a 37-yard drive to set up Andy Borregales’ 52-yard field goal with 15 seconds left, and New England beat the Buffalo Bills 23-20 on Sunday night, leaving the NFL without an undefeated team five weeks into the season.
titles: Patriots upset Bills to leave NFL without an unbeaten team
Drake Maye leads Patriots to win over Bills, leaving NFL without an unbeaten team
summary: The New England Patriots won against the Buffalo Bills 23-20, with Andy Borregales scoring a 52-yard field goal with 15 seconds remaining. This victory, led by Drake Maye's 37-yard drive, marked the end of the NFL having an undefeated team just five weeks into the season.

title: Seattle Ties Series 1-1 Against Detroit, Rodríguez Clutch in Game 2
snippets: Seattle and Detroit are meeting for the first time ever in the postseason
New York and Toronto will continue their best-of-five series on Tuesday
Julio Rodríguez hit a tiebreaking RBI double in the eighth inning and the Seattle Mariners beat the Detroit Tigers 3-2 in Game 2 of their AL Division Series on Saturday to even the series.

Mariners beat Tigers, Skubal to tie series
summary: Seattle and Detroit faced off in the postseason for the first time, with their series now tied 1-1 after Seattle's 3-2 win in Game 2 of the AL Division Series. Julio Rodríguez delivered a tiebreaking RBI double in the eighth inning. The series continues with RHP Logan Gilbert starting for Seattle against Detroit's RHP Jack Flaherty in Game 3. New York and Toronto are also set to continue their best-of-five series on Tuesday.

Japanese stocks soar and yen tumbles after Takaichi wins ruling party leadership
summary: The Nikkei 225 Index rose by 4.6% amid expectations of increased fiscal spending and continued low interest rates, following indications of an expansionary fiscal agenda by Takaichi for Japan, the world's fourth-largest economy. Concurrently, the yen experienced a decline.
